reviews.review: я поиграл в Sours и чесно говоря был разочарован её графикой, но меня порадовал интелект ботов он был на высшем уровне и онечно стрельба с мега точностью. Игра так себе!

CS:S - Это, когда ты пришел на сервер, а админ уже готов тебя кикнуть.
CS:S - Это, когда ты начал играть, а весь сервер уже тебя обосрал.
CS:S - Это, когда ты зашел после CS:GO и идешь со счетом 2:15(K/D).
CS:S - Это, когда ты играешь чисто для своего удовольствия!
10 из 10 банов.

Counter-Strike: Source - это римейк обычного Counter-Strike, выполненный на движке от Half-Life 2. Помимо улучшенного движка, полной поддержки Steamworks и пользовательских карт разработчики так же добавили в игру достижения, несколько изменили баланс и усовершенствовали графическую составляющую причем дважды. В 2010 году с очередным обновлением графики игра так же стала поддерживать Mac OS, новые экраны статистики и общей информации, новое отображение окончания раунда с интересными фактами об игроке, новую кинематографическую камеру смерти и 145 новых достижений.

I first bought this game to get Garry's Mod textures. After that, I figured I may was well actually play it, considering I bought the whole game, not just some textures. I hopped into a CS_OFFICE match with bots, hopped on the terrorist team, and entered the wonderful world of Counter Strike. 

This game's pretty good. It's Counter Strike, it doesn't need much introduction. Personally, I would recommend CS:GO over this version for general play, as CS:GO has a more active community, more official game modes ranging from standard competitive to co-op missions and the "Danger Zone" battle royale mode. It also has a matchmaking system and is completely free to play, whereas this game costs $15. If you never played Counter Strike before and you want to try it out, I would suggest starting with CS:GO.

This game has a few hidden tricks up its sleeve over CS:GO to the point that it's not totally obsolete, though. First, the engine is older and allows for more freedom with the Physics engine. Physics props are capable of interacting with players in more interesting ways, and knocking them around, leading to all sorts of various minigames that use the physics engine in novel and interesting ways. Map makers can also make vehicles using the func_vehicle entity, whereas this isn't possible in CS:GO. As a result, while the competitive and standard casual community in CS:S has languished and moved on to CS:GO, the modding and custom content community for CS:S is still going strong over CS:GO since there's stuff here that just isn't possible in CS:GO.

So, while I wouldn't recommend purchasing this game as a general Counter-Strike game, I would recommend purchasing this if you want to screw around with the custom community. As of the time of this writing, it's available on the Winter sale for 99 cents. That's an excellent price to join the mayhem of some func_vehicle or Zombie Escape servers. Plus, although CS:S also offers some servers that exist in CS:GO, like 24/7 deathmatch or surf, there's something . . . different about the attitude of CS:S players compared to CS:GO players. They just seem more chill. Like, they've accepted that their favorite game is no longer in it's heyday, but they don't let it stop their enjoyment or continued play, and they know there's a distinction between a game having a small community and a game being completely dead. They don't just get mad about hitboxes and yell at Valve to fix their game, they just play the game they have and are happy with it.
